objectives: Regulate and monitor animal factory farming practices in India

prohibited_items: Antibiotics not approved by the board
Any harmful, non-therapeutic drugs or hormones
permitted_use: Regular review of drug safety and resistance patterns

transportation.description: Transport of animals and animal products must comply with board-specified rules.

compliance_required: Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960
Humane housing, feeding, and veterinary care
No mutilation or confinement beyond humane limits

applicable_if: Introduction of new technologies or antibiotics
Risks identified to consumer health or local ecology

annual_audits.reporting_to: Animal Factory Farming Regulatory Board of India

responsibilities: Recordkeeping of inputs, outputs, and antibiotics used
Interfacing with state and central authorities

requirements: Minimize water consumption and reuse resources
Ensure worker health, safety and fair wages
Improve animal welfare with space, care and diet standards

regulatory_board.name: Animal Factory Farming Regulatory Board of India
powers_and_duties: Register all factory farms across India
Promote awareness on factory farming alternatives
Regulate product labeling regarding antibiotic use

non_compliance.description: Operating without license or violating prescribed standards
non_compliance.fine: Up to ₹50 lakh or 2% of annual turnover

failure_to_report.description: Failure to report audits, assessments or incidents

Sri Lanka.law: Animal Diseases Act No. 59 of 1992 & National Environmental Act
objectives: Control and prevention of animal diseases
Regulation of animal movement and quarantine

compliance_required: Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Ordinance
Proper sanitation and hygiene in farms

Nepal.law: Animal Health and Livestock Services Act, 2055 (1999)
objectives: Healthy production of animals and animal products

compliance_required: Prohibition of unnecessary pain or suffering

United States.law: Clean Water Act (CWA) & Animal Welfare Act (AWA)
objectives: Regulate discharge of pollutants into US waters
Ensure humane treatment of animals (limited scope for farm animals)
Manage manure and wastewater from CAFOs

compliance_required: Prohibition of discharge except in 25-year, 24-hour storm events
Humane Methods of Slaughter Act (for mammals)
State-specific anti-cruelty laws (often with agricultural exemptions)

objectives: Prevent or minimize pollution from industrial activities
Ensure high standards of animal welfare

compliance_required: Best Available Techniques (BAT) for pollution control

Canada.law: Health of Animals Act & Provincial Nutrient Management Acts
objectives: Manage nutrients to protect water quality

compliance_required: NFACC Codes of Practice (voluntary but industry standard)

Australia.law: Environment Protection Acts (State-based) & Animal Welfare Standards
objectives: Protect environment from pollution and waste

compliance_required: EPA License for intensive animal industries
Australian Animal Welfare Standards and Guidelines
Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Acts (State-based)
